page.title: 15RELIGIONS
page.content: In the area we have one Parish Church of St.John the Baptist at The Lea which is still quite well attended with a good number of young persons in the choir.This church has a history from the 12th.Century with the settlement of a recluse or anchoress in what was then a Chapel of ease under the control of Linton.(1315)Many visitors are attracted to the Church for its historical bells,old chest and an Halian stoup Font.There is a history of Nonconformity in the area as far back as 1662 with the birth of nearby Baptist Church at Ryeford and later a daughter church at Longhope.There is a Methodist Church at Bailey Lane End and a dis-used Methodist Church on the Bailey near to the Lea. The Quakers had a very strong influence in the past but this now appears to be nil.
